Message.Title: When is a stock a POS?
Message.Msg: Be impartial. It is when index is at new highs, sector as in SMH is at highs, yet POS stock is near lows, and have been doing nothing or dropping for many months. Hence, Nvidia, Amd etc qualifies for it. In fact amd could be better then Nvidia as it has rallied 30+% off lows. Hence someone could have cut and buy back to make $. For Nvidia, its a big pos cos its only 10+% off its lows!If u stay invested in it, it ties in your capital. U could have deployed it into better investments. Luckily, it has declared some dividends recently. But still, u could invest in others that pay dividend and grow share price.

Topic.Title: When is a stock a POS?

Message.Msg: Nvidia 20% from lows around 6 months ago. Where are you getting your numbers from?

Topic.Title: When is a stock a POS?

Message.Msg: Maybe, actually 20% if u include dividends, but still 20% off lows is still POS. Look at kLAC, semiconductor stocks paying dividend too yet at highs.

Topic.Title: When is a stock a POS?

Message.Msg: Well don't say 10% then. You really come off as a basher when you call something a POS and misquote numbers. I am sticking with this stock because it has shown strong resistance at levels above what I bought it at. I am already invested, I think it is an interesting long term play, and I'll be sticking with it. This paired with the fact that the stock as not been at these levels for 8 months is why I am excited. There have been numerous posts complaining about the stagnancy of the stock price, this is a fairly good sign that the stagnancy might be over.

Topic.Title: Shield price is set at $350.

Message.Msg: You can say whatever you want but that post has a price attached. Doesn't it? And the only source it could come from is Nviidia. Was it intentional or someone from Nvidia PR who placed that ad just screwed up? That remains to be seen.

Topic.Title: When is a stock a POS?

Message.Msg: Its all a matter of timing, Nvidia went up 300% off its 2009 lows. A LOT of people made big $$$. They are a company that was tied into a PC business that has the floor taken out from under them literally in about 3-4 years time. Did Dell forsee it? no. Did HPQ forsee it? NO. They were forced to change or die and i think they have done a hell of a job all things considered in about 2 years time. Broken stock, great company. Things are just starting to get interesting for Nvidia as they are moving into what looks like a full product Ecosystem.

Topic.Title: When is a stock a POS?

Message.Msg: Apple is a POS if u hold it through all these decline. Again, no stock is a great stock forever, and no stock is a POS forever too. This stock despite its recent rally is still one til it proves itself. A rally and a stay above a certain level say $16 should be able to neutralize its status. But at $13 or $14, really still cant rid its pos status. Fyi, I really think it has a good shot at rallying and become an outperformer. Cos its sector is doing well and this stock has consolidated for so long. However, it too has shown great promises previously only to disappoint again. Hopefully it doesn't. But til it does shows good follow thru, still have to objectively say its a POS at the moment.

Topic.Title: Shield price is set at $350.

Message.Msg: Man, you must be blind, so here comes the facts for you: 1. It's not ad or commercial. The wording says it all. It's a short article for popularization purposes. Nothing else. 2. The only source it could come from is article's author who could possible imagine the price out of thin air (or from an anonymous message board like this). 3. There has been no official pricing for Shield until now, so the price in the article could be anything but official info from Nvidia.

Topic.Title: QCOM's margin pressure

Message.Msg: "Qualcomm and Spreadtrum Communications have both cut prices for their quad-core products to better compete against MediaTek, which controls half of the smartphone-chip market in China, according to industry sources. Qualcomm recently quoted its quad-core solutions at less than US$10, slightly cheaper than MediaTek's offerings, the sources indicated. Meanwhile, Spreadtrum has lowered its quad-core processor prices to similar levels. Both firms are trying to gain market share through aggressive pricing, the sources said. Monthly shipments of MediaTek's smartphone chips have topped 15 million units recently, and even approached the 20 million level, the sources revealed. The booming shipments already lifted MediaTek's share of China's smartphone-IC market to 50%, the sources said. MediaTek's quad-core solutions reportedly have attracted orders from Coolpad, Huawei, Lenovo and ZTE. In other news, MediaTek has reported higher-than-expected sales for the first quarter of 2013. The firm has scheduled an investors meeting on May 6 to discuss its performance in the first quarter, and business outlook." for those here who refuse to admit there are different markets within the app proc market, the mobile app proc market is booming. Just not the part of the market that nvda targeted. The whole Tegra program is broken. T3, T4, T5, T6 won't make any difference cause they address a market that does not exist.

Topic.Title: Snapdragon 800 going into mass production in late May

Message.Msg: "In Snapdragon 800, we have a pretty dramatic bump up in performance. The chip features a quad-core Krait 400 processor clocked at up to 2.3GHz. The new Krait 400 processor comes with enhanced memory interface, with 2x32 LPDDR3 memory interface, lower latency to the main memory and quicker L2 cache. It also features the new Adreno 330 GPU bringing a nearly 50% improvement in graphics performance over Adreno 320, and nearly doubling compute performance. It support 4K HD video capture and playback at 30fps. It also supports cameras of up to 55 megapixels. " Did you read that part or did you igonre that part? lol

I'm a huge gamer, i haven't bought a console since i was 15 and the new generation of gamers is only becoming further detached from consoles.

Message.Title: Tablets will account for 64 billion game downloads in 2017 (Are you ready with your Tegra powered tablet?)
Message.Msg: Consumers are on pace to download 64.1 billion mobile games to their smartphones and tablets by 2017, more than tripling from 21 billion in 2012, Juniper Research forecasts. Juniper credits the increasing number of free-to-play releases, more sophisticated devices and the global uptake of smartphones for the surge in consumer interest, adding that advances in cloud-based, multi-platform gaming will position mobile devices as the primary screen for gaming enthusiasts. Social and casual titles will remain the most popular category, driving more than half of all mobile game downloads. Improved device memory also will enable gamers to download more games to their smartphones and tablets, Juniper adds. Tablet owners are already downloading twice as many games as their smartphone counterparts, Juniper states. "Tablet games are growing so much because they are such an accessible way for all consumer segments to access games," report author Si√¢n Rowlands explains. "In particular mid-core gamers, who previously spent a lot of money and time playing games but now have jobs, families or other commitments, are driving this trend. These people are really embracing the tablet form factor." fiercemobilecontentDOTcom/story/juniper-mobile-game-downloads-set-triple-eclipsing-64b-2017/2013-04-25#ixzz2RavuXjmA _____ PS: These downloads will not be done with game consoles, just mobile devices. AMD will have no role in this feast.

Message.Title: Is ibexx right? More mobile download = good news?
Message.Msg: Have u all heard that EA is struggling. Planning huge lay offs as people opt for free games via mobile downloads. So games like Battlefield will see less demand huh. More mobile downloads, yes, but the Mobile processor is becoming a commoditized product where mediatek qcom and Samsung thrives! Will_amd_yu just posted about it. Processor costs only $10. Nvidias habit of hyping and marketing for more pricey and better margins strategy in the graphics market aint working in the mobile world. Big companies aint biting it. So it aint a straight forward good news!

Topic.Title: Is ibexx right? More mobile download = good news?

Message.Msg: No you totally missed the point. EA games are declining because they cost $60 per game. Why pay $60 for a game when you can get free games off android or play one of the hundreds of new totally free to play titles. Nvidia is thriving on the F2P model of games like League of Legends, MMORPG's like Guild Wars etc. People are moving to these free 2 play graphics intensive games without any monthly subscriptions which means more $$$ for your PC. A few years ago only "nerds" played MMORPG's etc. now they are becoming so much more accessible and mainstream. As the overall PC market declines, the "Gaming PC" market is doing better than ever. This is where Nvidia sells $1000 graphics cards to people who want to pimp out their machines.
